hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Sentiment Exhaustion Fade (Crypto Headline Timing)
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a 'crypto regulatory' news headline (detected via news sentiment score < -0.3), if BTC price declines for two consecutive 15-minute candles but the cumulative decline is less than -1.5%, a reversal long within the next 1-2 hours has an edge, provided the overall regime is not STRESS.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Minor regulatory FUD often creates knee-jerk selling that exhausts quickly if the price decline is shallow, indicating lack of committed selling pressure. The edge comes from fading the overreaction of weak hands before cooler heads prevail, especially in non-STRESS regimes where systemic risk is low.
entry_conditions: News sentiment score (crypto regulatory) < -0.3 within last 2 hours
BTC 5min RSI(10) < 35 (oversold on very short term)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to pre-news reaction level (high of 15min candle before news) OR +1.8% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below the low of the second 15min red candle by > 0.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the average return of this setup is negative across all non-STRESS regimes, or if the success rate is below 50% when the 30min decline is between -0.5% and -1.5%.
